instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stack up @ 5.12V - 1.14a
threads.message:
hello everyone i have mbp <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> cant on, no sign of corrosion
unable to switch to 20v and i dont know which of 4 cd3215c00 ic is the problem. can somebody help me? thanks in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stack up @ 5.12V - 1.14a
threads.message:
1.15A is a lot for 5V input; something should heat on the board.
Check voltage and diode mode on all LDO rails of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
